Description: Oval dish of Nile silt pottery with rounded base and flaring sides, coated with red slip and burnished; the body is chipped in a number of places. The interior is decorated in thick yellow pigment with alternated bands of double zig-zags and stylised plant fronds
Curator's comments: Petrie’s White Cross line (C) ware. The bold style of the painted design is similar other oval dishes mainly without provenance, but possibly from Gebelein. Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no.2.
Condition: fair (body chipped in a number of places)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
